MajorClaims.MC1: the advertising is not the main cause of unhealthy eating habits
MajorClaims.MC2: advertising is not the primary reason of unhealthy eating habits

Claims.C1: advertising might lead to healthier eating customs due to the growing awareness of living under a better lifestyle
Claims.C2: advertising is not entirely decisive on personal eating habit
Claims.C3: advertising may even bring healthier eating habits to the people
Claims.C4: There are the build-up of the concept about healthy eating habits and self-control that really matter

Premises.P1: The key to forming a healthy eating pattern lies in people's concept of wholesome diets and self-control
Premises.P2: advertising always makes the products so tempting, regardless of whether they might bring negative effects on the human body
Premises.P3: advertising is not the only information source for people
Premises.P4: People can still acquire different viewpoints about foods from other sources, like news or magazines
Premises.P5: As long as people are clear about how to maintain a healthy body and they persistently keep track of their eating habits, they can successfully prevent themselves from those temptations
Premises.P6: It will be not persuasive if people just blame the advertising sector of a fast-food company for making them so fat and not reassess their own behaviors
Premises.P7: in the era when people are becoming conscious of a healthier lifestyle, some companies are actually aiming at this rising trend and start to promote healthy foods
Premises.P8: Think about the recently popular organic foods that are claimed to grow in an environment without pesticide and those crude foods in which less salt or less sugar are added
Premises.P9: These are the main traits that advertising is hitting on and the overall results are good
Premises.P10: the advertising industry bolsters people's awareness of having a healthy lifestyle
